logo design for Applejam (Polyhack 2017)

I won a design challenge to revamp the logo for Applejam Productions, a student organization that invites independent music artists to perform on the Tufts campus.

Final submissions: an abbreviated "AJ" icon, and a stacked version of the "Applejam" name (Click for full view)

  • time range: October, 2017 (overnight design challenge)
  • client: Applejam Productions
  • tools: pen and paper, FireAlpaca
  • my role: graphic designer, competitor

Since I was allotted only a few hours for this challenge, I relied a lot on instinct to come up with branding that I felt suited the personalities that Applejam Productions invites. I spent some time brainstorming style references, such as Summer of Love posters from the 60s and street art movements. In my sketches, I drew inspiration from psychedelic fonts, which were historically used to fill space in interesting ways rather than to be legible.

In my final digital designs, I used eye-catching colors and anthrompomorphized the text to convey both the high energy of Applejam's live shows with the handmade, eccentric quality of club's public image. My entry into this design challenge won me a license for Sketch, which I went on to use in later hackathons.

Notes and sketches from the ideation process (Click for full view)
